dialogue.prompt: Hey, I'm really struggling with coordinating my dad's care. We have this WhatsApp group that's always blowing up with unread messages—right now there are 17 I haven't even looked at. Then there's the Google Calendar that no one bothers to update properly, so appointments overlap or get missed. I keep a notebook where I jot down everything, but I'm the only one who uses it, and last week we nearly doubled his heart medication because my sister didn't realize I'd already given him his dose that morning. I end up spending over 10 hours a week just trying to sync everyone up, making calls, sending reminders, and double-checking details, but it still falls apart. It's exhausting, and I feel like I'm the only one carrying the load. Do you have any tips on how to handle family caregiving chaos like this? Maybe some apps or systems that could actually streamline things without adding more work?

For medication specifically, apps like Medisafe can track doses and alert family members to avoid mix-ups. Set ground rules for the group, like designating one person (maybe you) to update the calendar, and use automated reminders. If possible, involve a professional care coordinator or social worker for objective oversight. Hang in there; small systems can make a big difference.
